cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking slowly northwest toward the south-central Louisiana coast, then forecast to turn northward through the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City/Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain and Maurepas, Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southwest Louisiana coast, including Cameron Parish and adjacent bays
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) are likely Saturday through early Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 2–4 ft are possible in Calcasieu Lake and adjacent coastal areas; higher values (3–6 ft) just east of the port entrance toward Intracoastal City.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 4–8 inch totals with isolated higher amounts could produce flash and river flooding in the Lake Charles region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and significant lightning could disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements.
